controller

Class GoLFXController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.TopControl
      • controller.GoLFXController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class GoLFXController
extends TopControl
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller class which follows the MVC principle. Communicates with the packages: model and view. Connected to main window GoLFX.fxml.

      • GoLFXController

        public GoLFXController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
        initialises the GoLFXController class. The method initialise the game by: - setting up the listeners for the GUI-elements - setting up the GraphicContext, gc - setting up the animation - loading an empty board, data - loading a sound, sound - providing information about the canvas to the cInfo - setting the current rule set to the standard rule set (B3/S23) - adjusting the zoom to the view - initialising the dragHandler to enable the "dragging" -function of the canvas
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - URL
        rb - ResourceBundle
        See Also:
        gc, data

      • draw

        protected void draw()
        Uses GraphicContext to first clear canvas of graphic. The method then uses the Board-specific draw-method that takes the canvas and the GraphicsContext gc to draw the cells of the data-object.
        See Also:
        the Game of Life-object

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent me)
        Used to detect a MouseEvent, me, and initialise the dragging of the canvas. This enables the "moving" of the canvas while pressing the secondary button and dragging.
        Parameters:
        me - the MouseEvent from the user

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent me)
        Detects the release of the secondary button. This in turn disables the ability to "drag" the canvas on the screen.
        Parameters:
        me - the MouseEvent from the user

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent me)
        Detects if the "dragging"-function is active. If the function is active, the amount of movement is detected and used in order to alter the position of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        me - the MouseEvent from the user

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent me)
        Detects a MouseEvent from the user. If the primary button of the mouse is used, the MouseEvent, me is used to draw cells on the canvas of the Board-object.
        Parameters:
        me - the MouseEvent from the user
        See Also:
        drawWithMouse(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent)

      • scrollZoom

        public void scrollZoom(javafx.scene.input.ScrollEvent event)
        Detects scrolling from the user. The sizeSlider updates the position of the slider-point to represent the amount of zooming. The amount of zooming is determined with the ScrollEvent, event, and added to the present value of the sizeSlider.
        Parameters:
        event - the scrolling from the user

      • turnOnGrid

        public void turnOnGrid(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Draws the grid on the board. Determines if the checkGrid is checked and then update the canvas with the method draw.
        Parameters:
        e - ActionEvent from the user interface
        See Also:
        Board.setGrid(boolean), draw()

      • changeColor

        public void changeColor(javafx.event.ActionEvent ce)
        Changes the colour of the cells. Gets the current value from the cellColorPick and updates the color of the cells before calling method draw to redraw the board on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        ce - ActionEvent from the user interface
        See Also:
        Board.setCellColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color), draw()

      • changeBackgroundColor

        public void changeBackgroundColor(javafx.event.ActionEvent ce)
        Changes the background colour. Gets the current value from the backgroundColorPick, sets the new background colour and then updates the canvas with the method draw.
        Parameters:
        ce - ActionEvent from the user interface
        See Also:
        draw(), Board.setBackGroundColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color)

      • changeGridColor

        public void changeGridColor(javafx.event.ActionEvent ce)
        Changes the grid colour. Gets the current value from the gridColorPick, sets the new grid colour for the board and then updates the canvas with the method draw.
        Parameters:
        ce - ActionEvent from the user interface via a ColorPicker An action event to change the grid colour, via colour picker.
        See Also:
        draw(), Board.setGridColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color)

      • fitZoom

        public void fitZoom()
        Adjusts the zoom-level based on the number of rows and the number of columns from the board when the fitZoomButton is pressed. The zoom-level is determined based on whichever is largest in order to display the entire board in the canvas. The canvas is updated through the draw-method.
        See Also:
        data, sizeSlider

      • readRuleDesc

        public void readRuleDesc()
        A method used to read text file about rule description for different rules. The method assigns a description of the current rule set to the variable descRule in order to display that information in a dialog box. The variable ruleSet is assigned the value of the current rule set if one of the following occur: a new rule set is selected with the combo box containing the most known rule sets or if an imported RLE-file contains a rule set.
        See Also:
        the current rule set, the method that displays the information

      • threadOnAction

        public void threadOnAction()
        Responds to the threadOn check box. If the threadOn is checked, the optimizing-function of the Board-object, data is turned off.
        See Also:
        Board.setOptimaliser(boolean)

      • createAnimation

        public void createAnimation()
        Method for drawing graphics data to the screen, where the underlying data changes between each image(Animation). The method sets up the timeline-object by defining its cycle count and animDuration as a Duration-object. Source for the timeline setup: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/javafx/api/javafx/animation/Timeline.html
        See Also:
        the Timeline-object representing the animation, the method to be called in the animation

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.io.IOException
        An action to be perform when start button is clicked. If the timeline is not already either running or paused, the timeline will be played (the animation starts). If the timeline is already running or is paused, this method will cause it to stop the animation. Pressing the button while the timeline is either running or is paused will create a new DynamicBoard-object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - throw exceptions related to the error loading file and file loading. (https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/IOException.html)
        See Also:
        the Timeline-object representing the animation, fitZoom(), draw(), updateLabels()

      • pause

        public void pause()
        An action to be perform when the pause button is clicked. Will pause the timeline if it is currently running and resume the timeline if it is already paused.
        See Also:
        timeline

      • nextGeneration

        public void nextGeneration()
        A method to update the game board so that we move to the next generation of the game. The Board-object updates its board with its appropriate setNextGeneration-method. It is also possible to set the next generation of the Board-object on several threads concurrently if threadOn is selected. If the next generation is set with several threads, concurrently, the number of available processors numProcessors is used as a parameter, indicating the number of processors that are available. The board is then drawn to the canvas with the draw-method.
        See Also:
        updateLabels(), draw()

      • nextGenerationPrintPerformance

        public void nextGenerationPrintPerformance()
        Results with threads deltaTime in ms: 133 deltaTime in ms: 129 deltaTime in ms: 30 deltaTime in ms: 43 deltaTime in ms: 29 deltaTime in ms: 30 deltaTime in ms: 34 deltaTime in ms: 38 deltaTime in ms: 30 Results without indexPair and optimaliser = false Board: TuringMachine Iteration 1: 122 Iteration 2: 89 Iteration 3: 88 Iteration 4: 97 Iteration 5: 141

      • nextGenerationConcurrentPrintPerformance

        public void nextGenerationConcurrentPrintPerformance()
        Results with threads * 2, odd and even working deltaTime in ms: 236 deltaTime in ms: 28 deltaTime in ms: 27 deltaTime in ms: 28 Results without indexPair and optimaliser = false Board: TuringMachine Iteration 1: 134 Iteration 2: 51 Iteration 3: 35 Iteration 4: 36 Iteration 5: 53

      • fileChooseAction

        public void fileChooseAction()
        Chooses a RLE or LIF file and places it on the active board. A FileChooser is created to let the user choose a file from the hard drive. If the file is successfully read, the board is added to the existing data-object, available information about the RLE-file is displayed and the board is drawn to the screen. About setInitialDirectory: there is currently a bug that complicates the selection of a default directory, this is why the initial directory is set to default. Further implementation should contain a library of .rle or .lif files which are easily selectable in the .jar file.
        See Also:
        adjusts the representation of the board to fit the displayed canvas, draws the board on the canvas after data has added the byte[][] representing the board

      • chooseUrlAction

        public void chooseUrlAction()
        Retrieves a board from an URL. Sends the URL as a String to method readGameBoardFromURL which in turn extract pattern information from the URL. If extraction of pattern information is successful, the pattern is placed in the existing board. The labels of the board is updated through updateLabels and the board is drawn on the canvas.
        See Also:
        updateLabels(), draw()

      • openEditor

        public void openEditor()
        Opens the editor stage, which uses the EditorController. Sets the data-object as a variable in the EditorController and pauses the timeline while the new editorStage.
        See Also:
        {@link controller.EditorController}

      • onMouseSpeedClick

        public void onMouseSpeedClick()
        Sets targeted speed on mouse action on the speedSlider.
        See Also:
        speedSlider

      • updateI_label

        public void updateI_label()
        Updates the iterationsLabel with the current number of iterations.
        See Also:
        containing the number of iterations

      • updateAC_label

        public void updateAC_label()
        Updates the aliveCellsLabel with the current number of alive cells.
        See Also:
        label containing the number of alive cells

      • updateLabels

        public void updateLabels()
        Update all the labels on board (iterations, alive cells, board title, rule and author).
        See Also:
        updateLabels(), updateAC_label(), updateBoardInfo()

      • updateBoardInfo

        public void updateBoardInfo()
        A method that updates: board title, rule set and author. The method updates the labels directly, not through their respective methods.
        See Also:
        the label containing information about the board title, the label containing information about the current rule set, the label containing information about the author of the pattern

      • resetBoardInfo

        public void resetBoardInfo()
        Used to reset board information. Clears all the information fields.
        See Also:
        contain information about name of the pattern, comments and author, the label containing information about the board title, the label containing information about the current rule set, the label containing information about the author of the pattern

      • getDescRule

        public java.lang.String getDescRule()
        Gets the current rule set description. The rule set description is stored in variable descRule after being read from file.
        Returns:
        the current rule description

      • boardButtonActionPerformed

        public void boardButtonActionPerformed(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        A method to get information about board and show in a dialog box when the board button is clicked. Opens a new alert dialog with the necessary information.
        Parameters:
        e - ActionEvent
        See Also:
        contains information about name of the pattern, comments and author

      • instructionButtonActionPerformed

        public void instructionButtonActionPerformed()
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        A method to read "readme.txt" when the instruction button is clicked. The method opens a window to present this information to the user. Source: http://alvinalexander.com/blog/post/java/read-text-file-from-jar-file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - handles the file reading.
        See Also:
        TopControl.errorMessage(java.lang.String)

      • instructionView

        public void instructionView(java.io.BufferedReader txtFile)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Stack pane view which shows the text in a text file.
        Parameters:
        txtFile - to convert into an text view.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - handles if File is readable or not.

      • statisticsAction

        public void statisticsAction()
        Used to open a new stage for statistics data. The timeline is paused before opening the new stage in order to resume the animation at a later point in time.
        See Also:
        StatisticsController.setBoard(model.BoardPack.Board)

      • loadStage

        public void loadStage(javafx.stage.Stage s)
        Binds the canvas to the stage size making the size of the canvas dependent on the size of the stage. The canvas is set to be 0.80 of the stage height and 0.50 of the stage width. Currently inactive because canvas moves around on usage.
        Parameters:
        s - stage which is loaded
        See Also:
        stage, canvas

      • setFaqTest

        public void setFaqTest()
        Creates the button which displays a message when the qButton is hovered.
        See Also:
        the button that can be hovered
